segment.source: Get general developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: Get general developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Developer information about the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: The topics in this section provide useful information to developers about the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: The topics in this section provide useful information to developers about the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Important The Microsoft advertising libraries are a different set of extensions from the ad mediation libraries.
segment.target: Important The Microsoft advertising libraries are a different set of extensions from the ad mediation libraries.

segment.source: Use the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes in the Microsoft advertising libraries if you want to display banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft in a XAML or JavaScript app.
segment.target: Use the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes in the Microsoft advertising libraries if you want to display banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft in a XAML or JavaScript app.

segment.source: Use the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries if you want to display banner ads from multiple ad networks in a XAML app.
segment.target: Use the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries if you want to display banner ads from multiple ad networks in a XAML app.

segment.source: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.
segment.target: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.

segment.source: Provides UI and user experience guidelines for displaying ads in apps.
segment.target: Provides UI and user experience guidelines for displaying ads in apps.

segment.source: Test mode values
segment.target: Test mode values

segment.source: Provides information about test application ID and ad unit ID to use while you are testing your app.
segment.target: Provides information about test application ID and ad unit ID to use while you are testing your app.

segment.source: Set up ad units in your app
segment.target: Set up ad units in your app

segment.source: Describes how to replace test application ID and ad unit ID values in your app with production values from the Windows Dev Center dashboard when you finish testing your app and are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: Describes how to replace test application ID and ad unit ID values in your app with production values from the Windows Dev Center dashboard when you finish testing your app and are ready to submit it to Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: Error handling
segment.target: Error handling

segment.source: Describes how to handle errors that are generated by the AdControl class in the Microsoft advertising libraries.
segment.target: Describes how to handle errors that are generated by the AdControl class in the Microsoft advertising libraries.

segment.source: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store
segment.target: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store

segment.source: Describes requirements from the App Developer Agreement that apps with ads must meet before they can be published.
segment.target: Describes requirements from the App Developer Agreement that apps with ads must meet before they can be published.

segment.target: Supported ad sizes for banner ads

segment.target: Provides the supported sizes for banner ads.
